Hello All,

I am new to this forum and recently started with the FHIR implementation from scratch on my product.

Product background:
Healthcare Analytics platform which is integrating EHR data/Standard formats (HL7,CCDA,X12,CCLF and more). After Integrating data into repository,We are performing Measures and Analytics on ingested data. Moreover, We do support Interoperability in terms to sending out CCDAs from our platform to other vendors.

Things which I am looking for:
Develop FHIR resources per category
Modes of connectivity(Mutual TLS)
Security aspects on each API calls
Ideal performance of all API resources
Is there any pre-requisites which I must be adhere on it before exposing my FHIR APIs for all healthcare vendors?
Is there any requirements of certification for this implementation?

Waiting for the positive and descriptive response for my questions.
Thank you.

Develop FHIR resources per category: Not sure what you're looking for here - take a look at the resource list and see if you can find what you're looking for. If you have problems deciding, ask specific questions here.
Modes of connectivity(Mutual TLS); Security aspects on each API calls: FHIR supports and encourages TLS but doesn't mandate it - or any other particular security approach. Security should be based on your particular implementation's risk. Take a look at the security page to get started
Ideal performance of all API resources: FHIR is totally silent here. Some implementations may need milliseconds or less. Others will be fine with a second or two. Others will use asynchronous processing. You'll have to find out what's necessary/appropriate for your communication partners
Is there any pre-requisites which I must be adhere on it before exposing my FHIR APIs for all healthcare vendors?: Read the section on conformance
Is there any requirements of certification for this implementation?: We don't yet offer certification of systems. When/if we do, it'll probably be certification against specific implementation guides rather than against the base specification.

Hi @Lloyd McKenzie ,
How can I create a custom FHIR server If I have the database of patient related information? Appreciate any pointers to the existing implementation, tutorial or doc.
The simplest approach is to leverage one of the existing open source servers and then re-map the persistence layer to talk to your existing data base.

There are many trade offs to the various approaches.
I wrote a slideset on some of these that might be relevant for you.
https://www.slideshare.net/BrianPostlethwaite1/fhir-server-design-review

Thanks @Lloyd McKenzie and @Brian Postlethwaite for the quick response.
Let me think about it.
Vonk Facade is designed for this, see the documentation

Hey thanks @Christiaan Knaap for the suggestion but I am trying to build FHIR server in NodeJS. So I think I have to do manual mapping of JSON data to FHIR resources and support different operations as mentioned in standard.

@Bhushan Baviskar I would comment on the security, for the security you can simply implement oauth2.0 on your fhir server and the vendors who want to read from your fhir server would be the clients of your fhir server and those client will be given an access_token from your authorization server. Using that access_token your client would be able to read from your server. And of course you are also encouraged to implement SSL.

Thanks for the comment @Muhammad Abubakar .
I will add some security mechanism to my FHIR server as you mentioned.
My main concern was creating or generating FHIR resources from the JSON data and CCD document.

I am looking for any javascript library to generate FHIR resources from JSON data and CCD data instead of mapping individual fields manually.

Found some blue-button libraries and will try those. But If anyone has done this already, please share your views or sample code for reference.

Thanks.

@Bhushan Baviskar What suggestions I can give:

1. See how your data has formed the entities, the relationships, and all the stuff

2. Compare your entities and fhir resources, that how your data is formed and what fhir says that how some specific data should be formed. For example, you have an entity for a purpose but fhir divided that into two resources and vice versa.

3. You just need a fhir facade that will sip your data and will throw in a fhir format. For that you can consider any platform because your major problem is to fit your data to the fhir resources. So, you can also consider other platforms according to their ease of mapping your data to the fhir.

4. You can read the spec and write your facade or you can avail some opensource or commercial products for that. kindly refer to this page http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=Publicly_Available_FHIR_Servers_for_testing

Thanks @Muhammad Abubakar for quick response.
I am in a process of creating a FHIR facade only based on the defined FHIR specs.

Any Suggestions for selecting the Middleware Programming language and the Database For a FHIR based System?
No doubt that we need to scale the performance and save large number of records in these systems.

Thanks to All.

Depending on your architecture, you won't necessarily need middleware at all. In terms of database, there are a wide variety of approaches available. We have reference implementations that use relational, nosql and blob-based storage systems. The driver will be less FHIR and more what else you're expecting to do with your data.

What is or where can one find the description of HL 7 of FHIR workflow from the moment a physician decides to ask an some imaging (e.g. X-ray) for a patient till the images are delivered?

There is no "single" FHIR workflow for that process because there's no single clinical workflow for that process. It varies by country, by system and sometimes by clinican or type of image. It can/will also vary in terms of how much automation exists in the process. The options are described by the "workflow" page in FHIR.

For FHIR I found in http://hl7.org/fhir/resourcelist.html a list of defined “resources” and from it links to their descriptions and implementations.
Where can I find a similar listing of HL7 V3 defined messages? (I spent time looking for it, without success).
Where can I find updated data about the degree of adoption of V2, V3 and FHIR?

V2, V3 and FHIR are completely different standards that are managed in very different ways. There's no equivalent to "resource" in the v3 world. Instead it has interactions and RMIMs. And those are maintained in separate chapters. You can find all of the ones defined by HL7 international in the v3 Normative Edition, but much of the actual v3 messaging implementation has happened against country-specific interactions and RMIMs and there's no central index of those. v2 has segments and messages and those can be found in the HL7 v2 specification.

Unfortunately it's very difficult for HL7 to track adoption of its standards. There's been the odd study done on v2 adoption in various geographies, but I'm not aware of anything recent. And I'm not familiar with any reports that gather that information for v3 or FHIR (and FHIR is changing so rapidly that any information gathered would quickly be out of date).
Thanks and Regards

Hi:

We have an EMR with a domain model interacting in its own spring-hibernate backed ecosystem.

I got the plain HAPI FHIR server working with some hard coded patient data and deployed to a tomcat server and I'm at a point to start integrating with some of our backend EMR services.

I intend to write a spring-enabled converter layer that converts our EMR models to HAPI-FHIR java models (as a separate spring project with the EMR datasource configured etc.) and it would have a main spring config class that enables this translation.
e.g. querying for a patient with ID

  1. FHIR server receives the request
  2. A custom spring service internally calls our EMR service (available via a dependency library api) to query for a patient and translated to a FHIR patient model.
  3. The Resource provider gets the fhir-patient model that becomes the response of the initial request.

Am I thinking right about this set up? If not, I'd like to hear best practices of implementing FHIR over an existing EMR.

Thank you for your inputs.
